intro: Palala elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf palala, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
